page.title: 15History of Cathcart
page.content: The district of Cathcart is quite famous in it's history and has one or two noteable landmarks. For example, there is a stone in Court Knowe from where Mary Queen of Scots is said to have watched the battle of Langside. On this stone is a monogram of her name. There is a place in Old Castle Road known as the Old Smiddy which was originally a blacksmiths and the famous poet Robert Burns often went there to get his horses hooves seen to when he was on a very long journey. The Old Smiddy is still there but now people go there to get food because it is a restaurant. Over from Court Knowe there is an entrance to Linn Park and here there is a tree stump which is over 200 years old. In Court Knowe there are huge quarries which were dug for coal.
